title: Who was in Jurgen Klopp's first Liverpool team vs Man Utd

Jurgen Klopp first faced Manchester United as Liverpool boss back in January 2016, just three months after taking the reins at Anfield.

Louis van Gaal was his opposite number that day and it was Manchester United who ran out 1-0 winners over the Reds at Anfield.

Wayne Rooney netted the only goal of the game ten minutes before the end, meaning Klopp's first experience of the derby was one to forget.

Fast forward three years and things are a little different.

Manchester United are in free fall and currently sit two points above the relegation places.

Liverpool, on the other hand, are unbeaten in their first eight Premier League fixtures and sit eight points clear at the top of the table.

(Image: Getty Images)

Klopp has achieved this early feat by assembling a sensational team at Liverpool, with quality in every position.

But things haven't always been this way.

Here we look at the Liverpool starting XI selected by Klopp to take on Manchester United back in 2016, and see where the players are now.

Simon Mignolet

Where is he now? Club Brugge

Mignolet rotated between being Liverpool's No.1 and sitting on the bench for a few seasons before Loris Karius became Klopp's favoured option between the sticks.

(Image: Liverpool FC via Getty Images)

But Karius would go on to drop two clangers in the Champions League final, prompting Klopp to splash the cash on Alisson.

Mignolet, realising first team opportunities were now impossible to come by, eventually moved back to Belgium.

Nathaniel Clyne

Where is he now? Liverpool

The right-back looked certain to run Liverpool's line for years to come after joining from Southampton, but has suffered countless injuries at Anfield.

This, coupled with the emergence of Trent Alexander-Arnold, saw Clyne disappear from everyone's minds, but he enjoyed some football on loan at Bournemouth last season.

Alberto Moreno

Where is he now? Villarreal

The Spaniard never showed consistency during his time on Merseyside; sometimes performing well, other times dropping clangers.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

Going forward Moreno often looked dangerous, but it was when tracking back that the left-back let himself and his team-mates down.

Eventually Klopp opted to sign some competition for Moreno in the form of Andy Robertson, and well, the rest is history.

Mamadou Sakho

Where is he now? Crystal Palace

Another inconsistent performer on Merseyside, Sakho sometimes looked assured and assertive at the back, other times he looked nervous on the ball and was prone to a clanger or two.

Klopp would often rotate the centre-back and never seemed truly convinced by him.

Eventually the Frenchman was sent out on loan to Crystal Palace, and impressed for the south London club. So much so in fact that Palace went on to sign him permanently in a deal worth £26million.

Emre Can

Where is he now? Juventus

It's unclear why the German was so keen to leave Liverpool as it always appeared that Klopp was a fan of his compatriot.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

But for whatever reason Can let his contract run down at Anfield and joined Juventus on a free in the summer of 2018.

Things haven't gone to plan for the midfielder though, with Can falling down the pecking order in Turin and even being left out of the club's Champions League squad this season.

Lucas Leiva

Where is he now? Lazio

Lucas was neither forced out for not being good enough nor moved on because he didn't want to be at Liverpool anymore.

He'd simply done his time on Merseyside after 10 years and went to Italy to try something new with Lazio before retirement.

James Milner

Where is he now? Liverpool

Many would have assumed Milner was on his way out when Klopp took the reins.

(Image: Getty Images)

The midfielder was pushing 30 and was used to fill the gaps at Liverpool as opposed to win games for the Reds.

But no one told Klopp he'd need a shotgun to get rid of Milner and four years on he's won a Champions League with the Reds and is still in the team. Incredible.

Kolo Toure

Where is he now? Retired

The Arsenal Invincible spent three seasons at Liverpool from 2013 to 2016 before moving to Celtic for a single campaign.

Toure signed on a free transfer and provided some important cover for the Reds.

But given his ages, and the fact he was signed as experienced cover rather than a long-term centre-back, he was eventually released.

Jordan Henderson

Where is he now? Liverpool

Henderson joined the Reds from Sunderland in 2011, four seasons before Klopp took the reins from Brendan Rodgers.

(Image: REUTERS)

Over the years he's been tipped to follow in the footsteps of David Beckham and also criticised for not becoming David Beckham.

Despite the ups and downs, praise and criticism, Henderson is Liverpool captain and skippered the side to Champions League glory last season.

Adam Lallana

Where is he now? Liverpool

Injuries have plagued Lallana's time at Liverpool, which has seen him play very little football over the past few years.

Klopp has always appeared to be a big fan of the former Southampton man, who offers some creativity in the middle of the park - something Liverpool lack at times.

But Lallana is 31 now and perhaps running out of time at Liverpool.

Roberto Firmino

Where is he now? Liverpool

The biggest success story of the team from 2016.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

It's crazy to think that it was Rodgers who signed the Brazilian, given the fact he is the epitome of a 'Klopp player' - the man who kick-stars the heavy mental gegenpress.

Firmino is one of the first names on Klopp's Liverpool teamsheet in 2019 and a man he will be hoping can make the difference against United on Sunday.
description: Sunday's fixture at Old Trafford will be the tenth time Jurgen Klopp has faced Man United as Liverpool boss
